question: 二巻
sourceMnemonic: The number <kanji>two</kanji> <kanji>scroll</kanji> is the <vocabulary>second volume</vocabulary>. With Japanese books, they often come in pieces with groups of three being common. This represents the <vocabulary>second volume</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
